Larry Rodriguez, COO

Larry Rodriguez is COO of Digital Cloud Group, he is an acknowledged business leader with extensive operational experience in new technology startups and the motion picture industry. Previously, Rodriguez played a key role in the technical operations, development and design of Vumanity LLC, a new ground breaking software and technology that creates User Generated Content (UGC) over the internet. The Vumanity project also employed the creative talents of distinguished visionary media creators, a sound analyst who worked for the CIA and NSA along with a host of talented computer programmers.

As an experienced studio executive well versed in all aspects of film production with a detailed focus on post-production and distribution, Rodriguez served as the Head of Post Production and Worldwide Film Services for numerous major Hollywood Studios and independents such as Metro Goldwyn Mayer (MGM), First look Studios, Blue Rider Pictures, and Maya Entertainment. In addition, he was responsible for the completion, technical acceptance and distribution of all feature film master material needed for global distribution.

Based in Los Angeles, Rodriguez played a key role in Operating multi-platform content and distribution companies and helped them establish themselves as leaders of media products that appealed to the mainstream and multi-cultural audiences. Working directly under entertainment industry pioneers, Moctesuma Esparza (Selena, Gettysburg), Jeff Valdez (SiTV, QuePasa.com) and Sergio Aguero (Y Tu Mama Tambien, Quarantine, Without Reservations), Rodriguez distributed entertainment programming to retail stores, iTunes, Hulu, Netflix, and on VOD through Time Warner Cable, Comcast, iN DEMAND, and TVN.
Bryan Duran, Esq. CEO

Bryan Duran is the CEO of Digital Cloud Group. Prior to joining the Digital Cloud Group, he was an attorney at Starz Media where he successfully closed well over 300 film acquisition deals in less than three years for the US, UK, Canadian, and Australian offices. Bryan started his professional career as a financial analyst on Wall Street working on a bond trading desk before returning back to Los Angeles where he transitioned into corporate finance for a large multi-national financial services firm. With a strong finance background, Bryan decided to specialize in entertainment finance at Warner Bros. and NBC Universal serving as a liaison between the corporate finance group and the business & legal affairs department. Bryan took a liking to business & legal affairs and decided to go to law school fulltime through an accelerated program at Southwestern University School of Law.

After graduating from law school, Bryan joined a former NBC Universal executive at the VOY Group to acquire independent films for distribution. Inspired by the founder of VOY, Bryan launched www.pango.biz, the first online auction style marketplace for independent movies, music, and books, before being lured by the COO of First Look Studios to join their legal team with a focus on film acquisitions.

Mr. Duran graduated Magna Cum Laude from the University of Southern California holding a dual emphasis degree in finance from the Marshall School of Business and entrepreneurship from the Lloyd Grief Center for Entrepreneurial Studios.
